Dear Ms. Hagen:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Samantha Way, area manager at 517-243-9743.
Sincerely,
Pinkey Brown, Licensing Consultant

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
SPECIAL INVESTIGATION REPORT
I. IDENTIFYING INFORMATION
Special Investigation #: 2025SIC0000036
Special Investigation Intake Date: October 15, 2024
License #: CB280200990

Agency Name: Holy Cross Services - Northern Michigan CB
Agency Address: 3597 Henry St.
Norton Shores, MI. 49441-6723
License Status: Regular
License Expiration Date: 02/18/2025
II. METHODOLOGY
Contact Date Contact Method Contact Purpose

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Medical and dental care policy
Title
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12413
Section • (1) An agency's medical and dental care policy must,
Description include all the following:
• (e) A dental examination must be completed within 3
months before entry into foster care or an initial
dental examination must be completed not more
than 90 calendar days after entry into a foster care
out-of-home placement. A child entering foster care
under 1 year of age must have an initial dental exam
within 3 months of his or her first birthday.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Foster care specialist did not ensure a required dental visit was
completed for a foster child regardless of multiple communications
to ensure this was completed.
Investigation Health Liaison Officer was interviewed via telephone 10/25/24.
Health Liaison Officer reported Foster Child A was due for an
initial dental visit no later than 9/14/24. Health Liaison Officer
reported she contacted the agency Associate Director (AD) on
8/8/24 regarding the initial examination and was informed by
Associate Director that the Foster Care Specialist assigned to the
case was currently not working and the AD will follow up with the
foster care specialist the following Monday.
Health Liaison Officer reported she followed up with a telephone
call to the Foster Parent (FP) via telephone after not hearing back
from the agency AD or Foster Care Specialist. She reported she
asked the FP if Foster Child A (FCA) dental visit had been
scheduled. Health Liaison Officer reported FP informed her FCA’s
dental examination had not been scheduled. Health Liaison
Officer reported she told FP to schedule the dental visit and to let
the Health Liaison Officer know the date of the scheduled dental
visit for FCA. Health Liaison Officer said she informed the FP
during this conversation that if the FP could not get a dental visit
scheduled for FCA before 9/14/24, the Health Liaison Officer
could assist FP with scheduling a dental visit for FCA. Health
Liaison Officer reported she contacted FP again on 8/15/24 due to
no return telephone call from the FP, FP did not answer the
2

telephone and Health Liaison Officer said she did not leave a
message.
Interview with Associate Director (AD) via video conference
10/25/24. She reported Foster Child A's (FCA), Foster Care
Specialist 1 (FCS 1), left the agency without notice on 8/30/2024.
She reported she assigned the case to Foster Care Specialist 2.
AD said she requested FCS 2 to complete a home visit at the
home of Foster Parent in September 2024 complete a well-being
check of FCA, verify if a dental examination had been scheduled
and to provide updates to Associate Director if there were any
noted safety issues. Associate Director reported when FCS 1 left
the agency she (AD) took over FCS 1’s cases and she would take
full responsibility for FCA not receiving her initial dental
examination. Associate Director reported the agency is still
understaffed and workers are prioritizing keeping children safe by
way of monthly home visits and wellbeing checks. Associate
Director reported the initial dental examination should have been
completed prior to 9/14/24.
Associate Director said FCA's case was recently assigned to FCS
2, and she will work with FCS 2 to follow up with the initial dental
examination of FCA. Associate Director reported FCS 2
completed a home visit in September 2024 and reported Foster
Parent had not scheduled a dental appointment for FCA.
Associate Director reported since FP had not scheduled the dental
appointment for FCA as of the September 2024 home visit, a
special investigation #2025SEC0000041 was initiated on the
foster home. Associate Director reported FP was not following the
agency placement agreement regarding medical and dental of a
foster child.
Foster Care Specialist 2 was interviewed via telephone on
10/25/24. She reported when she went to the home visit in
September 2024, Foster Parent reported to her she had
scheduled FCA’s dental appointment for 8/29/24. She reported
Foster Parent reported she wanted all of the children in her home
to go to the same provider where the children in her home are
comfortable. FCS 2 reported Foster Parent did not show her any
paperwork of the scheduled dental appointment for FCA, and she
did not request or ask for documentation. FCS 2 said she took
Foster Parent’s word of scheduling the dental appointment and
she did not do any follow up. She had no additional information
other than FCA was in a safe and clean environment and was up
to date with her well child physical examination.
3

Attempted telephone calls were made to Foster Parent regarding
the allegation on 10/25/24 and 11/7/24. The telephone number
provided by the agency and in MiSACWIS for the Foster Parent is
a non-working telephone number.
Documents reviewed:
• FCA’s case record was reviewed. FCA was born on
6/17/23 and placed in the home of Foster Parent on 7/5/23
from the hospital. FCA was up to date with all of her well
child examinations.
• Social Work Contact dated 11/25/24, written by FCS 2
stated that Foster Parent reached out to the Dentist office
on 8/29/24 for FCA initial dental appointment. The dentist
office cancelled the dental appointment that was scheduled
for 8/29/24. Foster Parent found another provider and FCA
will not be seen for her initial dental appointment until
February 2025.
• Timeline of dates Health Liaison Officer provided in an
email she had with the agency and foster parent are as
follows:
▪ 7/3/24 - Email to Holy Cross Foster Care Specialist
1, (FCS 1) Director with reminder regarding initial
dental visit due on 9/14/24. Asked FCS 1 to provide
Health Liaison Officer with the date the visit is
scheduled by 7/17/24.
▪ 7/19/24 - Health Liaison Officer emailed FCS
1/Director stating she have not heard back regarding
the initial dental visit date.
▪ 7/29/24 - Health Liaison Officer email to FCS
1/Director stating she have not heard back regarding
the dental visit. Request a scheduled dental date
immediately.
▪ 7/31/24 - Health Liaison Officer email to Holy Cross
Associate Director regarding lack of response from
FCS 1. Needed to know date for September
examination for FCA.
▪ 7/31/24 – Health Liaison Officer contacted FP and
discuss FCA’s dental examination and offered her
assistance in scheduling the dental appointment for
FCA.
▪ 8/7/24 – Health Liaison Officer contacted FP, left a
message and did not receive a call back from Foster
Parent.
▪ 8/8/24 - Email to Holy Cross FCS 1 and Associate
Director regarding the initial dental visit and needing
4

to know if dental appointment was scheduled and
will it be completed by the due date.
▪ 8/13/24 - Email to Holy Cross FCS 1 and Associate
Director stating still have not received a response
regarding the date of the dental visit.
▪ 8/23/24 - Email to Holy Cross FCS 1 and Associate
Director asking for response regarding the dental
visit date.
▪ 10/8/24 - Requested dental record from dental
provider to determine if FCA’s dental visit was
completed.
▪ 10/8/24 - Response from dental provider stating
child in question has never been seen in the office.
▪ 10/10/24 - Email to newly assigned Holy Cross FCS
2 and Associate Director asking if the dental visit
was completed.
▪ 10/10/24 - Email from Holy Cross, FCS 2 stating she
reached out to the foster parent requesting the date
that FCA’s initial dental visit was completed.
▪ 10/11/24 - Email from Holy Cross, FCS 2 stating she
has not heard back from the foster parent.
Analysis Health Liaison Officer reached out to FCS 1 and the Associate
Director regarding a timely initial dental appointment that was due
by 9/14/24. Health Liaison Officer began contacting the agency
assigned Foster Care Specialist and Associate Director from July
to October 2024 for an initial dental examination for FCA. Health
Liaison Officer offered her assistance with scheduling the dental
examination for FCA with the FP. The AD admitted she did not
follow up with the FP in scheduling and getting FCA’s initial dental
examination completed timely, the agency is found in non-
compliance.
Conclusion Violation Established
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12325 License recommendation
Section (1) An agency shall recommend to the department the
Description appropriate licensing action consistent with facts contained
in the foster home evaluation and any special evaluation.
Violation Additional Finding
Type
Allegation The agency opened a special investigation on the foster home
regarding foster child initial dental examination, but facts does not
support the findings.
5

Investigation Health Liaison Officer was interviewed 10/25/24, via
telephone. Health Liaison Officer reported she contacted the
agency Associate Director and Foster Care Specialist 1 on several
occasions beginning in July 2024, by way of telephone calls and
emails inquiring about FCA’s initial dental appointment that was
due by 9/14/24. Health Liaison Officer reported after many
unanswered attempts from the agency, she contacted the Foster
Parent. Health Liaison Officer said finally she reached the Foster
Parent on 8/2/24. Health Liaison Officer said she discussed with
FP who had not scheduled a dental appointment for FCA at that
time that if FP could not get a scheduled appointment for FCA,
that the Health Liaison Officer could assist FP in scheduling an
initial dental appointment for FCA. Health Liaison Officer reported
she never heard back from FP.
Associate Director (AD) was interviewed on via video
conference on 10/25/24. AD admitted she did not follow up with
FCA’s initial dental appointment and that she takes full
responsibility for FCA’s dental appointment not being completed
timely. AD reported the assigned Foster Care Specialist (FCS 1)
left the agency without notice on 8/30/24. AD reported she
opened a special investigation on the foster home due to FP not
following the agency policy and Foster Care Agency Agreement
regarding dental examination of a foster child.
Licensing Specialist (LS) was interviewed via phone on
1/27/25. She reported she could not remember how she verified
that FP had scheduled the initial dental appointment for FCA. She
said she believes FP showed her a scheduled dental appointment
on her phone. LS reported that FP was a nice provider and was
frustrated that she was getting messages and getting in trouble
over scheduling a dental appointment. LS reported the FP wanted
to take FCA to her biological son dental office for FCA’s dental
appointment, but that FCA was not on the same network as her
son and that this dental office did not accept FCA insurance. LS
reported she did not cite FP because she believed FP scheduled
the dental visit timely, and FP was communicating with the agency
about the dental appointment being scheduled. LS reported FP
was trying to get all of the children scheduled for private insurance
and attend the same dental office as FP’s biological son.
LS reported she is aware of the policy of scheduling a foster
child’s dental appointment timely however, being that FP tried to
schedule the dental appointment, and that FP was a good
6

provider, she did not cite the foster home in her special
investigation.
Documents reviewed:
• Agency medical and dental policy/Foster Parent Agency
Agreement last dated by Foster Parent 4/19/24.
Agreement stated that Foster Family agrees to be
responsible for the daily care of the Foster Child including,
but not limited to food, clothing, shelter, medical needs…
• A letter was sent to Foster Parent dated 7/8/24, by the
agency Administrative Analyst. The letter notified FP that
FCA who was placed in FP’s home that a medical and/or
dental examination was due. The letter stated this was the
FP first notification that an appointment must be scheduled
within 45 days of receipt of the letter. Included in the letter
that once the appointment is scheduled, notify the assigned
Foster Care Worker of the date, time, and location of the
appointment. The letter also stated all corresponding
paperwork received from the provider must be provided to
the Foster Care Worker within 7 days of the appointment.
Licensing Rules for Foster Homes R 400.9412 Medical and
Dental Care, all medical and dental appointments are
required to be completed timely. This letter informed the FP
that if the FP experiences difficulty with scheduling
appointments, to reach out to the Foster Care Worker or the
assigned Licensing Worker.
• Special investigation report #2025SEC0000041 on Foster
Parent home dated 10/15/24 and completed on 12/5/2024.
Foster Parent was found in compliance due to Foster Parent
explaining she had scheduled dental visits for FCA.
Analysis The agency completed a special evaluation of the foster home,
but the findings did not support the facts of FCA’s initial dental
examination being completed timely. There were numerous
communications informing the FP of the date of the dental
examination as well as offering assistance to the FP by Health
Liaison Officer. The agency is found in violation as the
recommendation of the special evaluation does not support the
facts. To date, FCA has not completed her initial dental
examination.
Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
7

Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
